com.google.wave.api
Class StyledText

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.StyledText

public class StyledText
extends java.lang.Object

StyledText represents a styled text region, that provides API to set or unset StyleType. The StyledText can then be used within the TextView to modify the document content. This object is meant to be used for convenience. The underlying text representation is disjoint from the document. Therefore, once the text is appended / inserted into the document, modifying this object will have no impact on the document.

Author:
mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya), scovitz@google.com (Seth Covitz)
See Also:

public StyledText(java.lang.String text,
                  StyleType style)

Method Detail

addStyle

public void addStyle(StyleType style)
Adds an additional style to this text.

Parameters:
style - The style to be added.

appendText

public void appendText(java.lang.String text)
Appends text to the end of the styled text range. All current styles will apply to the resulting text.

Parameters:
text - The text to be appended.

getStyles

public java.util.List<StyleType> getStyles()
Returns the list of styles applied to this object.

Returns:
the list of styles.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Returns the text managed by this object.

Returns:
the text managed by this object.

insertText

public void insertText(int start,
                       java.lang.String text)
Inserts text at the starting index provided. Styles applying to the current text will apply to the combined text. If the index does not exist, the text is appended to the end of the document.

Parameters:
start - index into current text with which to perform the insertion.
text - the text to be inserted.

removeAllStyles

public void removeAllStyles()
Removes all styles from this text object.

removeStyle

public void removeStyle(StyleType style)
Removes the requested style from the list of styles for this text.

Parameters:
style - the style to be removed.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
Sets/replaces the text of this object. The resulting text continues to be styled by the styles added previously to this object.
